intro: Lepidaploa purpurata, commonly known as the purple spurge, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a reddish or purplish tinge, adding to its ornamental appeal. It is often used in gardens for its vibrant color and ability to spread through rhizomes.
